content.en: Algorithmic Bone Diagnosis: Researchers are investigating the capabilities of algorithms in dual-energy CT scans to accurately diagnose and detect various bone marrow lesions and edema in different parts of the body, such as the ankle, vertebral compression fractures, hip joint, and scaphoid fractures. They are also exploring the potential of single-source dual-energy CT and three-material decomposition with dual-layer spectral CT algorithms in detecting acute vertebral fractures and bone marrow edema. These algorithms aim to provide added value to MRI and increase the visibility of trabecular fractures, offering new possibilities for evaluating skeletal traumas.
content.da: Algoritmisk Knoglediagnostik: Forskere undersøger algoritmers evner i dual-energy CT-scanninger til nøjagtigt at diagnosticere og opdage forskellige knoglemarvslæsioner og ødemer i forskellige dele af kroppen, såsom anklen, vertebrale kompressionsfrakturer, hofteleddet og skafoidfrakturer. De udforsker også potentialet i single-source dual-energy CT og three-material decomposition med dual-layer spektrale CT-algoritmer til at opdage akutte vertebrale frakturer og knoglemarvsødem. Disse algoritmer sigter mod at tilføre merværdi til MR-scanninger og øge synligheden af trabekulære frakturer, hvilket giver nye muligheder for at evaluere skelettraumer.
